content.heading: Most Common Red Flags & Logical Traps
content.text: Learn to identify and avoid these common mistakes that trap students.

concept_box.title: Logical Traps to Avoid
points: üö´ **Trap 1**: Choosing a word that 'vibes' right ‚Üí **Solution**: Move from 'feels right' to 100% provable
üö´ **Trap 2**: Getting fooled by complex details ‚Üí **Solution**: Ditch the Details, focus on simple main ideas
üö´ **Trap 3**: Distinguishing between synonyms ‚Üí **Solution**: If two choices are synonyms, both are wrong
üö´ **Trap 4**: Picking a word that's close but not perfect ‚Üí **Solution**: Match author's precise intent
üö´ **Trap 5**: Technically correct but not the best ‚Üí **Solution**: Choose the most specific connection

elements.reveal: The 100% Rule: The correct answer is flawless. Every other choice has logical traps.

üìà **Cause/Effect** - Therefore, consequently, as a result, thus

examples.contrast: However, Nevertheless, In contrast, Granted, Admittedly (signals opposing ideas)
examples.cause_effect: Therefore, Consequently, As a result, Thus (signals reason or outcome)
examples.addition: Moreover, Furthermore, In addition, Likewise (signals more points on same topic)
examples.example: For example, For instance, Specifically, Namely (signals clarification)
examples.summary: In short, In sum, To summarize, Ultimately (signals final conclusion)

common_mistakes: Choosing transitions that 'feel' right instead of logical matches

Not recognizing when two similar transitions cancel each other out
Picking technically correct but not most precise answers
